word.entryDescription: the state of being employed
word.entryExample: I think education is so important for these kids – it can make the difference between a lifetime on benefits or a lifetime in employment.

word.entryDescription: past form of 'empty' – to remove everything that is inside some container, some place, etc
word.entryExample: I emptied my bag because couldn't find my phone.

word.entryDescription: to gradually take something such as power or land
word.entryExample: The new housing developments encroach on the greenfield land.

word.entryDescription: to be in a particular place or state after or because of doing something
word.entryExample: How did you end up going on to the talent show?

word.entryDescription: rare and in danger of dying out
word.entryExample: Its wildlife is endangered by the Pacific rat, a 'visitor' to the island.

word.entryDescription: species of animal or plant that is in danger of dying out completely
word.entryExample: The number of endangered species of plants and animals is increasing.

word.entryDescription: a supply of physical power that we need for doing things requiring physical effort
word.entryExample: You need a lot of energy and stamina to run a marathon.

word.entryDescription: the use of energy or power
word.entryExample: I think that by 2100, world leaders will have changed their policies on energy consumption.

word.entryDescription: the waste of energy
word.entryExample: Passive houses are well-insulated to minimise energy loss.

word.entryDescription: a device used in ventilation systems that allows to recover heat from exhaust air from the building
word.entryExample: Passive houses don't require air-conditioning or fan systems because they make use of natural shade by positioning the windows correctly and they generate fresh air through an energy recovery ventilator.

word.entryDescription: being in a state where it is agreed that you will marry
word.entryExample: She is engaged to her fiancé Edmund.

word.entryDescription: the part of a vehicle which produces power to make it move
word.entryExample: The taxi had a problem with its engine.

word.entryDescription: somebody who designs or repairs machines or electrical devices, or designs large structures
word.entryExample: She worked hard at maths and science at school, because she wanted to be an engineer.

word.entryDescription: the largest country in Britain
word.entryExample: Is England in Europe?

word.entryDescription: giving pleasure
word.entryExample: I would thoroughly recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for an enjoyable and memorable experience.

word.entryDescription: fun, pleasure that you get from something
word.entryExample: You'll get a lot of enjoyment out of working with the kids.

word.entryDescription: extremely large
word.entryExample: Biomes are enormous greenhouses.

word.entryDescription: all that is necessary
word.entryExample: If you don't eat enough fruit and vegetables you can get scurvy.

word.entryDescription: make certain that something happens or is done
word.entryExample: I will do my best to ensure your safety during the journey.

word.entryDescription: a strong interest in something, and a strong desire to be involved in it
word.entryExample: She has a real enthusiasm for her work.

word.entryDescription: to be keen and interested in what you're doing
word.entryExample: Most of the players are very talented, motivated and absolutely enthusiastic about the game.

word.entryDescription: the part of a building or an area where people go in
word.entryExample: They can't find the entrance.

word.entryDescription: the land, water and air of the Earth
word.entryExample: A clean, healthy environment is very important to most people.

word.entryDescription: decorations worn on the shoulder of a shirt or jacket, especially as a part of a soldier uniform
word.entryExample: The scouts wore very decorative epaulets on their shoulders.

word.entryDescription: one part of a series of programmes which tells a continuing story
word.entryExample: Everybody’s talking about the final episode of the most popular series on television!

word.entryDescription: an imaginary line around the middle of the Earth which is an equal distance from the North Pole and the South Pole
word.entryExample: Algeria is north of the Equator.

word.entryDescription: a thing you use to remove the marks made by a pencil
word.entryExample: Rub out the mistake with an eraser.

word.entryDescription: to get away from something or someone that is holding you or causing you danger
word.entryExample: A suspected mugger has escaped from their van as they were about to drive to the police station.

word.entryDescription: a short piece of writing on a subject, particularly one done by a student
word.entryExample: Meg has finished writing her essay.

word.entryDescription: absolutely necessary
word.entryExample: Who thinks games are essential in giving kids a break from lessons?

word.entryDescription: someone whose job is to help people buy, sell or rent property
word.entryExample: The estate agent from this agency sold me the most beautiful house I've ever seen.

word.entryDescription: a set of rules for behaving correctly in social situations or particular professions
word.entryExample: Social etiquette dictates that men should let women enter a building first before they go in themselves.

word.entryDescription: the unit of money used in most countries of the EU; 100 cents; €
word.entryExample: This phone is amazing, but it costs 400 euros.

word.entryDescription: a continent west of Asia between the Mediterranean Sea, the Atlantic Ocean and the Arctic Ocean
word.entryExample: The five Olympic rings represent the five continents: Africa, America, Asia, Australia and Europe.

word.entryDescription: despite what has just been said
word.entryExample: I felt awful but even so I went to the party.
I managed to stay incredibly calm, even though I was frightened.

word.entryDescription: the part of the later day and early night when it gets dark
word.entryExample: She usually goes jogging in the evening.

word.entryDescription: after a long time, and often involving a lot of problems or effort
word.entryExample: Eventually, she found the information she needed on the internet.

word.entryDescription: on each day
word.entryExample: I brush my teeth twice every day.

word.entryDescription: every person
word.entryExample: Everyone should arrive by 7.00 p.m. to give us time to prepare everything.

word.entryDescription: all things
word.entryExample: Everything is very untidy in the room.

word.entryDescription: information gathered by the police or given in court which suggests that someone is guilty or not guilty; information gathered by scientists that confirms or denies a previously formulated hypothesis
word.entryExample: Scientists say that there is much evidence that some animals can use tools.

word.entryDescription: to develop or change over a long time
word.entryExample: When something evolves, it changes over a period of time.

word.entryDescription: the woman who you have divorced
word.entryExample: Michael, and his ex-wife Frances divorced five years ago.

word.entryDescription: an important test of a student's knowledge or skill, usually coming at the end of a course or school year
word.entryExample: Finally, the exam finished and Ms Green came to collect our answers.

word.entryDescription: the paper that you write your answer on in an examination
word.entryExample: I submitted my exam paper at the last moment.

word.entryDescription: an isolated examination room or space in a hospital
word.entryExample: My mum is being examined in the examination cubicle at the intensive care unit.

word.entryDescription: to dig into the ground, particularly when doing archaeology
word.entryExample: As this is a historical area, before any building can be done the site will have to be fully excavated.

word.entryDescription: to be or become more than a particular number, amount or limit
word.entryExample: Over half of us don't exceed the speed limit given the chance.

word.entryDescription: to give something to somebody and receive something from them
word.entryExample: I'd like to exchange it for this small one, please.
